title.narrative: (IMS) Media Development in Support of Democratic Governance & National Reconciliation in Myanmar

description.narrative:
The main focus of this program is to contribute to building of a sustainable media environment, in which the media can fulfil its role as the Fourth Estate of Democracy through the application of a proper legal framework, access to professional standards and capacity development, a rising level of public access and its ability to reflect and represents the diversity of views and interests in society, including those of marginalized groups.
Expected Outputs: 1. Nationally driven process for development of the media sector in Myanmar is created and sustained, and support and interventions better coordinated. 2. Capacity to reform media related policies and legal frameworks and to engage in democratic transitions further is enhanced. 3. The foundation for media to professionalize further developed, and significant steps are taken to meet training needs of media practitioners. 4. Access to information and outreach of media in rural areas and among minority populations is expanded. 5. Impartial and professional reporting on peace process is increased, and continuous media support for national reconciliation efforts is ensured.
